body:
- Look at one of the directories under staging/src/k8s.io/ (Please don't pick more than one directory for one PR as it will cause issues for reviewers)
- Find all the files named `doc.go` (example find staging/src/k8s.io/client-go/ -name doc.go)
- See the following link it has a `// import "k8s.io/client-go/tools/remotecommand"` this tells tools how this package needs to be imported. So we should ensure that each doc.go has an import
   https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/1fc36a5743bc02d62ddaac6cd41b71f0ef191ce2/staging/src/k8s.io/client-go/tools/remotecommand/doc.go#L20
- Add a description appropriate to the package (similar to the one below)
   https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/1fc36a5743bc02d62ddaac6cd41b71f0ef191ce2/staging/src/k8s.io/client-go/tools/remotecommand/doc.go#L17-L19
- Look through sub directories and see if there are any other important directories that are likely to be used by outside users and add a doc.go

Why are we doing this?
- We perfer to use vanity urls instead of directly using github.com to refer to code, so this helps ensure that tools honor our wish. See https://golang.org/doc/go1.4#canonicalimports
- It would be good to have some package level documentation since these directories under staging/ are meant to be for use by folks outside of kubernetes github org.

/good-first-issue

labels.description: Issues or PRs related to kubernetes code organization
labels.name: area/code-organization

labels.description: Denotes an issue ready for a new contributor, according to the "help wanted" guidelines.
labels.name: good first issue

labels.description: Denotes an issue that needs help from a contributor. Must meet "help wanted" guidelines.
labels.name: help wanted

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to documentation.
labels.name: kind/documentation

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Architecture.
labels.name: sig/architecture

title: update doc.go in staging/ repositories
